intro: Burmeistera ceratocarpa var. dentata, commonly known as the toothed burmeistera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow or orange. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with serrated edges, which contribute to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded to semi-shaded habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some gardens, though it remains relatively uncommon in horticultural trade.
